meanings.definition: To bring to a state of perfection
meanings.sent1: She consummately decorated the cake for the party.
meanings.sent2: He always consummately finishes his work before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel consummately organized its acorn collection.
meanings.sent4: The artist consummately painted the sunset with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef consummately crafted a delicious meal for the guests.

meanings.sent1: They consummately wrapped up the project after months of hard work.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle was consummately finished by the child.
meanings.sent3: The cat consummately caught the elusive mouse in the house.
meanings.sent4: The final piece consummately fit into the jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The team consummately crossed the finish line together in the race.

meanings.sent1: The tailor consummately altered the dress to fit perfectly.
meanings.sent2: She consummately polished her speech before the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The gardener consummately pruned the bushes into animal shapes.
meanings.sent4: His words consummately conveyed the depth of his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The architect consummately designed the building with intricate details.
